alert.note: Alert for Elko (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 15 at 5:36AM PDT until further notice by NWS Elko
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Elko has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Nevada... Jarbidge River Below Jarbidge affecting Elko County. .Flows are currently oscillating just below and above Action stage. Warm temperatures continue to melt snow, and rainfall in the forecast may cause flows to increase more. For the Jarbidge River...including Jarbidge...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by the combination of rain and snowmelt is possible. * WHERE...Jarbidge River Below Jarbidge. * WHEN...From early this morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 5.5 feet, Minor flooding occurs along the Jarbidge River near Jarbidge. Pine Creek and Bluster campgrounds are flooded. Minor erosion occurs along the primary access road from Idaho to Jarbidge (seasonally, the only access road). * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:10 AM PDT Monday the stage was 5.1 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Action stage is 5.0 feet. - Flood stage is 5.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 200 PM PDT.
